objects.name: busy buzzard
objects.description: Busy Buzzard is a plugin-based Windows remote access tool deployed as an RC4-encrypted Windows DLL with a shellcode loader stub that decrypts and reflectively loads the DLL into memory. It exists in at least two variants: a TCP variant using raw TCP for command-and-control (C2) and an HTTPS variant that uses HTTP POST parameters with RSA-encrypted beacon data and RC4-encrypted, Base64-encoded tasking. Busy Buzzard supports loading and executing shellcode plugins and DLL plugins (using LoadLibraryW/GetProcAddress), injects into process memory, performs anti-analysis checks for VMware (registry key and VMXh port checks), generates randomized RC4 keys for each C2 loop, uses a hard-coded RSA public key to protect initial beacon keying, and includes helper functions (send/connect/rc4/calc_crc32/etc.) provided to plugins. The malware is in-memory, modular, and has been observed in samples compiled from at least 2016 through 2019, with open-source reporting indicating continued development into 2021.

objects.name: Trend Micro
objects.description: Trend Micro is cited as an open-source reporting source referenced by the report, noting a newer Busy Buzzard TCP variant compiled in April 2021 and indicating actor development.

objects.name: PwC
objects.description: PwC is referenced as the source that attributed a similar User-Agent string to the ChChes malware family; used in this report for comparative attribution of User-Agent similarities.

objects.name: Virus Total
objects.description: Virus Total is referenced as the repository where initial Busy Buzzard memory dump samples were uploaded and used to identify multiple Busy Buzzard samples and variants.

objects.name: Shared Modules
objects.description: Busy Buzzard uses the LoadLibraryW and GetProcAddress API functions to load additional modules and execute functions from them.

objects.name: Native API
objects.description: Busy Buzzard uses the VirtualAlloc and CreateThread API functions to inject and execute shellcode plugins.

objects.name: Process Injection: Proc Memory
objects.description: Busy Buzzard is injected into the memory of a process, with additional shellcode modules also injected into the memory of the same process.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: System Checks
objects.description: Busy Buzzard tests the Windows Registry for the presence of a key associated with VMware. The HTTPS variant also tests for the presence of the VMXh port (associated with VMware) using the IN assembly instruction.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: The Busy Buzzard shellcode plugin provides the capability to browse files and directories.

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: The Busy Buzzard beacon contains OS, username, hostname and process information.

objects.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
objects.description: The Busy Buzzard beacon contains the victim IP address.

objects.name: System Time Discovery
objects.description: The Busy Buzzard beacon contains the time at which the implant was started.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Busy Buzzard (HTTPS variant) uses HTTPS protocol for command and control communication, sending RSA-encrypted and Base64-encoded beacon data in POST parameters and receiving RC4-encrypted tasking.

objects.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: Busy Buzzard (TCP variant) uses raw TCP protocol for command and control communication.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel
objects.description: The Busy Buzzard beacon is RSA-encrypted using a hard-coded public key. Other C2 communications use RC4 encryption with a shared randomly generated key.

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_command_switching_and_ok_response
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_convert_crc32_to_mutex_name
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_convert_crc32_to_mutex_name
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects code bytes used by the TCP variant of Busy\nBuzzard to convert a CRC32 value to its hex string representation in\nreverse-nibble order"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "8fd99d9066020003358aa3e23c9af3d4911ce979"
        hash2 = "266852db4ad2d293469515820fd5e7c228cd4b3e"
        hash3 = "d2b8f4fe6eedb8b87521772fc823da596f2403b7"

    strings:
        // loop that converts a 4-byte value to its hex string
        // representation (in reverse)
        $ = {0F B6 C2 24 0F 3C 09 76 02 04 07 04 30 48 FF C1 C1 EA 04 49
FF C8 88 41 FF 75 E5}

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_original_dll_names
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_original_dll_names
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects Busy Buzzard original DLL names embedded\nwithin the binary"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "8fd99d9066020003358aa3e23c9af3d4911ce979"
        hash2 = "266852db4ad2d293469515820fd5e7c228cd4b3e"
        hash3 = "6a673508d46c0bbff74ee24384c8bc841c11ea4d"
        hash4 = "e74affd6c766156e3fe803917f28da08fe7000ef"
        hash5 = "48152eeb1d74a84ba86b34f419cf1c7a105e41ff"

    strings:
        $ = "httpsWin32.dll\x00"
        $ = "tcpcX64.dll\x00"

    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_random_rc4_key_generator
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_random_rc4_key_generator
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects code bytes used by Busy Buzzard to\ngenerate the randomised RC4 key"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "8fd99d9066020003358aa3e23c9af3d4911ce979"
        hash2 = "266852db4ad2d293469515820fd5e7c228cd4b3e"
        hash3 = "d2b8f4fe6eedb8b87521772fc823da596f2403b7"
        hash4 = "6a673508d46c0bbff74ee24384c8bc841c11ea4d"
        hash5 = "e74affd6c766156e3fe803917f28da08fe7000ef"
        hash6 = "48152eeb1d74a84ba86b34f419cf1c7a105e41ff"

    strings:
        // x86
        $ = {99 B9 3E 00 00 00 F7 F9 83 FA 0A 73 05 83 C2 30 EB 0D 83 FA
25 73 05 83 C2 37 EB 03 83 C2 3C 8B 03 88 14 06 46 3B F7}
        // x64
        $ = {44 8B D8 B8 43 08 21 84 41 F7 EB 41 03 D3 C1 FA 05 8B CA C1
E9 1F 03 D1 6B D2 3E 44 2B DA 41 83 FB 0A 7D 06 41 83 C3 30 EB 10 41 83
FB 25 7D 06 41 83 C3 37 EB 04 41 83 C3 3C 48 8B 4D 00 48 FF C3 48 FF CE
44 88 5C 0B FF 75 B0}

    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_https_cmd_response_stack_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_plugin_helper_functions
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_plugin_helper_functions
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects code bytes used by Busy Buzzard shellcode\nplugin helper functions"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "f737067d41bc77dc7dd09ecb6eb710619bc2dfde"
        hash2 = "cf6339501de54590f8bbbc3cfb8051b95f6a1a42"

    strings:
        $ = {56 48 8B F4 48 83 E4 F0 48 83 EC 20 E8 F7 DF FF FF 48 8B E6
5E C3 48 C7 C0 30 00 00 00 65 48 8B 00 48 8B 40 60 48 8B 40 18 48 8B 40
10 48 8B 00 48 8B 00 48 8B 40 30 C3}

    condition:
        (all of them) and (filesize < 20KB)
}

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_shellcode_loader_x64
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_rsa_public_keys
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_rsa_public_keys
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects hard-coded RSA public keys used by both\nthe TCP and HTTPS variants of Busy Buzzard"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "8fd99d9066020003358aa3e23c9af3d4911ce979"
        hash2 = "266852db4ad2d293469515820fd5e7c228cd4b3e"
        hash3 = "d2b8f4fe6eedb8b87521772fc823da596f2403b7"
        hash4 = "6a673508d46c0bbff74ee24384c8bc841c11ea4d"
        hash5 = "e74affd6c766156e3fe803917f28da08fe7000ef"
        hash6 = "48152eeb1d74a84ba86b34f419cf1c7a105e41ff"

    strings:
        // Hard-coded RSA public keys used by Busy Buzzard samples
        $rsa1 =
"MIGJAoGBANYrLIbgWsKfJOnWnk/YUJmgFxI5PMK31Rnj7AOR37VM66baxx/6+03/IbT4oe/P
y9YBYUIILhZTcCGOjv/KW+nZoQ4gdkDXexP7kD2YuwEKQZB1WSG3MTPNLCWANvGMrX+Cb/9H3
qJ/mmIYrygcLmzj4E2rSxJfdZ3YaYI1IX/vAgMBAAE=\x00"
        $rsa2 =
"MIGJAoGBAK7mh7RSMtisKLn+Jfkq9AUlOHqUe4zjTLVC89k+sPux5ZMr9ndtjzdx8bCcSfCQ
temKrR2LY4lRr5cZs3jgwaBbHS2SdCezUuNUdrEEsfWX8BlK13G8djFmmYZqKeQFnUrKZn+uA
0A4nIGPRFKB2fKfBjh4Y5qN2IoyV9Y0e8HHAgMBAAE=\x00"
        $rsa3 =
"MIGJAoGBALkXcETCNbKRUMlz0Bkl8Mr/Jm1A4VKxdLBlDXCtD/9fCrfSDl2z/JhykFJik787
pT05QuKIsLWZLv2/lqMlDxnKEPEQRDBdm900If27xShcK/qRoSOO8edUD44PphF5cMfK16VMo
N9e3DEVeP4zduCanP4vbFpH3vwaTI1Or1QRAgMBAAE=\x00"

    condition:
        (1 of ($rsa*))
}

objects.name: BusyBuzzard_mutex_random_bytes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule BusyBuzzard_mutex_random_bytes
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects additional random bytes used by TCP\nvariants of Busy Buzzard to generate a unique mutex name"
        date = "2022-03-25"
        hash1 = "8fd99d9066020003358aa3e23c9af3d4911ce979"
        hash2 = "266852db4ad2d293469515820fd5e7c228cd4b3e"
        hash3 = "d2b8f4fe6eedb8b87521772fc823da596f2403b7"

    strings:
        // Additional random bytes used by TCP variants of Busy Buzzard
to generate a unique mutex name
        $rand1 = {61 87 67 6C 6A DB 4A C6 58 D1 61}
        $rand2 = {CF 4F 26 6A 57 77 5B B7 AB D4 29}

    condition:
        (1 of ($rand*))
}

objects.name: identify_kernel32_version
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"

rule identify_kernel32_version
{
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5a4d) and pe.is_dll() and pe.is_64bit() and

  (pe.export_details[pe.exports_index("GetProcAddress")].offset ==

         pe.rva_to_offset(0x19d70)) and
        (pe.export_details[pe.exports_index("LoadLibraryA")].offset ==
         pe.rva_to_offset(0x1f560)) and
        (pe.export_details[pe.exports_index("VirtualAlloc")].offset ==
         pe.rva_to_offset(0x1b220)) and
        (pe.export_details[pe.exports_index("VirtualFree")].offset ==
         pe.rva_to_offset(0x1b970))
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Busy Buzzard
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. busy buzzard.
